title: ISic003285. Epitaph for Eutrapelion
body:
Facsimile Images

Εὐτραπε-
λ̣ί̣ων ((christogram))

Apparatus criticus

Text based on photograph; Korhonen does not exclude the possibility that the block could have been damaged on the right side: in that case, another possible reading could have been Εὐτράπε[λος] | ἐτῶν [---]. However, it does not seem there is sufficient space for the numeral between ἐτῶν and the Christogram.
line.2: Ferrua: ((Chi-Rho))Σ

English translation

Eutrapelion.

Italian translation

Eutrapelion.

commentary

According to Korhonen, the block must have been placed outside a burial chamber. The name Εὐτραπελίων is not attested, while Εὐτράπελος is attested in southern Italy in the imperial period (see LGPN 3A: 177).

bibliography

  • 185 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • Ferrua 1989 119 no.455 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001995
